artist: Artist: Paul Jacoulet; Carver: Maeda Kentarō; Printer: Uchikawa Matashirō
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by May McBride Guarisco
description: two figures on a mountain ledge; figure in back wears loose tan garment with green vest, resting on PR leg eating a persimmon; figure in foreground wears black flowing pants, pink vest, orange billowing shirt, and red headscarf, sitting with staff in PR hand; mountains and birds in background
image_copyright: © Paul Jacoulet %2F Artists Rights Society %28ARS%29%2C New York %2F ADAGP%2C Paris
markings: LLC, artist\'s red sparrow seal ; LRC, R margin: Uchikawa Matashirō suri 内川又四郎摺, Maeda Kentarō tō 前田謙太郎刀; LRC, bottom margin, black stamp: [Bergers des Hautes Montagnes / Coree...]; on back: LLC, red stamp: [178/350]
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Bergers des Hautes Montagnes - Coree...
